p: Table 1, Table 2, Table 3 and Table 4 report the major constituents in essential oils produced during the two-year period and their proportions. Sesquiterpene hydrocarbons were the dominant compounds in most samples but some molecules showed strong seasonal variations, including thymol, an oxygenated monoterpene. This compound was not detected in some essential oils but was the major molecule in other samples ( Figure 1b).
